item.title: No lighting, 7th January
item.description:
Have reported previously. Apparently nobody knows where to locate power source. There is 12 car park lights and another 3 that light the children's playground. Also the lights to the entrance of 179-285 Frances st been out for months. Block and car park and play area in complete darkness. No resolution from Greenwich. Problems with ansociail behaviour and drug use. Community police have been great. Greenwich rubbish over a year bo resolution.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Frances Street, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant inconsiderate parking, 7th January
item.description:
Parking is very limited, but the same car is constantly taking up 2 spaces with 1 car despite numerous friendly conversations. It’s getting to a point where we are having to block in other residents to be able to park because this same grey Audi doesn’t know how to park his car. As a suggestion, could we potentially look into making the car park residents only by means of permit or gate installation, or at a minimum installing parking bay lines to clearly outline where to park. The parking area usually fits 6 vehicles however due to the inconsiderate parking of the Audi on a daily basis we can only fit 4 vehicles. The carpark in question is at 357-367 Plumstead high street SE181JX, the entrance to the carpark is via woodhurst road.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodhurst Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road wear and tear between road and pavement, 7th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bevington Road, Beckenham, Greater London
